items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
River levels are high on the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water, but are expected to begin falling in the early hours of 16/11/2022.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 16/11/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Duddon, River Crake, Mill Beck
River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.message:
River levels are high but steady at the Whitewater Bridge river gauge as a result of recent heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible from Tuesday evening, 15/11/2022.  Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads around Mansfield, the Sherwood Forest Caravan Park at Clipstone, Edwinstowe, Ollerton, Whitewater Lane at Whitewater Bridge and West Drayton.   Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. Further rainfall is possible on Wednesday.
We are closely monitoring the situation. 
Please avoid using low-lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated by 08:00 on Wednesday, 16/11/2022, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed. 

River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. We will continue to monitor the situation and re-issue this alert if necessary. The forecast is for a largely dry night tonight (15/11/22) and tomorrow daytime, with a chance of further rainfall tomorrow evening.

Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels.

River levels are forecast to rise at the Broadwey river level gauge as a result of the ground being saturated and reacting to rainfall this evening (15/11/22) and tomorrow morning (16/11/22). Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Wey, Preston Brook and River Jordan. Consequently flooding of roads and farmland is possible. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. We will continue to monitor the forecast and update this alert if necessary. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 17:00 on Wednesday 16th November or as the situation changes.

Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels have risen on the River Wey as a result of heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of roads and farmland is expected to continue this evening, 15/11/22, around the Passfield Mill area. Further rainfall is forecast over the next few days. We expect river levels to remain high as a result. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 16/11/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Stour and Smestow Brook in the Black Country and South Staffordshire
items.message:
River levels have risen at the Halesowen Manor Way River gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected this afternoon.     
Further rainfall is forecast for this evening. We expect river levels to rise during this time.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow morning on 16/11/22, or as the situation changes.

River levels are rising at the Swans Barn river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall this morning. Consequently, flooding of roads and low lying land is possible later today, 15/11/2022.  Flooding will affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to River Cole between Majors Green and Coleshill.
Showers are forecast this evening before more rain arrives late tomorrow afternoon, 16/11/2022. We expect river levels to remain high.
We are closely monitoring the situation.
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated tomorrow, 16/11/22, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed. River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold, however further rainfall is expected over the next 24 hours, we will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

floodArea.county: Bath and North East Somerset, Wiltshire

items.message:
River levels have risen at the Bradford on Avon river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall throughout Tuesday morning. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible between 20:00 today, 15/11/22, and 12:00 tomorrow, 16/11/22.  We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads between Melksham and Bathford. The flood gates at Holt Road may be closed.
Further showery rainfall is forecast throughout Tuesday evening and into Wednesday. River levels will start to fall from 12:00 on Wednesday 16/11/22, but they are forecast to rise again during Wednesday night in response to another band of rainfall moving over the area.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff have been clearing weed screens.
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  
This message will be updated on Wednesday morning, 16/11/22, or as the situation changes.

River levels are rising at the Mancetter river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall this morning. Consequently, flooding of roads and low lying land is possible later today, 15/11/2022.  Flooding will affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Anker between Nuneaton and Tamworth the River Sence between Temple Mill and Ratcliffe Culey. Showers are forecast this evening before more rain arrives late tomorrow afternoon, 16/11/2022. We expect river levels to remain high.
We are closely monitoring the situation.
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.  
This message will be updated tomorrow, 16/11/22, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.county: Bracknell Forest, Surrey, Windsor and Maidenhead

items.message: Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels are rising on the Chertsey Bourne as a result of heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of roads and low lying land is expected later this evening, 15/11/22, around the Free Prae Road area. Further rainfall is forecast over the next few days, therefore levels may remain high as a result. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 16/11/22, or as the situation changes.

River levels are forecast at the Basford Bridge river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall forecast this afternoon 15/11/22. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible this afternoon 15/11/22 and tomorrow afternoon, 16/11/22. Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Churnet between Leek and Rocester and the River Tean between Adderley and Spath including Cecilly Brook at Cheadle.
Further showers are forecasted over the next 24 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until tomorrow 16/11/22.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast. 
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses. Plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and stay aware in case further warnings are issued. 
This message will be updated tomorrow morning, Wednesday 16/11/2022, or as the situation changes.

River levels are rising at the Cheswick Green river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of property/roads and farmland is expected possibly later today 15/11/22. Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Blythe between Cheswick Green and Blyth End.   
Showers are forecasted this evening before more rain arrives late tomorrow afternoon 16/11/22. We expect river levels to remain high. 
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow 16/11/22, or as the situation changes.

items.message: Water levels have risen at the Sherborne Lake river gauge as a result of the recent heavy rainfall. Consequently, there is a low risk of flooding to low-lying land and roads today, Tuesday, 15/11/22. Locations most vulnerable to flooding are the Sparkford to Weston Bampfylde road and Deep Ford Lane, Chetnole. Further showers are forecast throughout today, 15/11/22, and tomorrow morning, 16/11/22. We expect river levels to remain high over the next 24 hours. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the situation. Please avoid using low-lying footpaths and plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers which may be flooded. Please refer to local authority website for local road closures. This message will be updated by 12:00 on Wednesday, 16/11/22, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Asker, River Brit, River Bride, River Char, River Lim

items.message: The Flood Alert has now been removed as river levels on the Rivers Lim, Char, Winniford, Simene, Brit, Asker, Mangerton and Bride are slowly dropping. Be aware that standing water and debris may still remain. There are showers forecast for this evening (15/11/22) and tomorrow morning (16/11/22) but these are not expected to increase river levels We will continue to monitor the forecast and issue an alert if necessary.

The River Uck is high but falling in Buxted and should begin to fall in Isfield by 22:00 Tuesday 15/11/2022. However, showers from 03:00 early Wednesday morning, followed by widespread rainfall Wednesday afternoon, could cause flooding. From 20:00 on 16/11/2022, flooding could affect fields, rural roads, gardens and approach riverside properties through Buxted, near the White Hart pub and areas around Hempstead Mill on Hempstead Lane, Uckfield. Flood impacts could affect the Roller Mill, Mill Lane, River Way, Bridge Cottage & Bell Walk, Uckfield. From 22:00 on 16/11/2022 flood water could approach properties at Isfield Mill and Isfield Bridge. Only small amounts of rain are forecast Thursday to Saturday, which should allow the River Uck to return nearer to normal Thursday afternoon. If we receive the maximum amounts of rain predicted, river levels could peak similar to last week. Flood protection products are recommended to be installed in Buxted and Isfield, if you have them. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 14:00 on 16/11/2022.

items.message: River levels have risen as a result of heavy rainfall today. Flooding of roads and low lying land is expected from 6pm this evening, 15/11/2022. We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads around Forest Row, Ashurst, Hartfield, Penshurst and particularly on and around Balls Green and Ashurst. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. Further rainfall is forecast over the next two days. We expect river levels to remain high until Thursday, 17/11/2022. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are out on the ground checking and clearing any blockages and debris from rivers and actively monitoring the situation and are prepared to respond if required. Please stay aware in case further warnings are issued. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 16/11/2022, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper River Mole, Ifield Brook, Gatwick Stream and Burstow Stream
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex

floodArea.riverOrSea: Ifield Brook, River Mole, Gatwick Stream, Burstow Stream

items.message:
River levels have risen as a result of heavy rainfall today, Tuesday 15 November. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible. Property flooding is not currently expected.
River levels remain high. Further heavy rainfall is forecast over the next two days. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are clearing trash screens and actively monitoring the situation and are prepared to respond if required.
This message will be updated by 8am on Wednesday 16 November 2022, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen throughout Tuesday 15/11/22 at the Trowbridge Paxcroft river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall. Although levels are now starting to fall, they remain above the alert threshold. Consequently, the risk of flooding remains. We expect flooding may affect the Westbury Road (A363) at Yarnbrook, Hawkeridge Road at Horse Bridge, Shallow Wagon Lane at Heywood and West Ashton Road at Trowbridge. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. Further showery rainfall is forecast throughout Tuesday night and into Wednesday. We expect river levels to continue falling overnight on Tuesday 15/11/22. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are clearing weed screens. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures. This message will be updated on Wednesday morning, 16/11/22, or as the situation changes.

The River Adur is high and rising. 20mm of rain has been recorded at Cowfold Tuesday morning, which is a lot in a short period. From 23:00 15/11/2022 flooding could affect the A281 at Mock Bridge, near Shermanbury. As well as extensive water in fields, flooding could also affect gardens of properties near Mock Bridge. The River Adur should begin to initially fall by 03:00 16/11/2022. However, further heavy showers are expected Tuesday night and early Wednesday morning. Another 20-30mm of rain is also predicted Wednesday evening. We expect river levels to rise again and possibly higher Wednesday evening. If we receive the maximum amounts of rain predicted, river levels could peak higher than last week. Some roads may become impassable. Please plan to avoid driving through routes vulnerable to flooding, including the A281 at Mock Bridge, near Shermanbury. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 12:00 16/11/2022.

The River Ouse is high and rising between Scayne's Hill and Barcombe, following 20mm of rain Tuesday. Only minor flood impacts are expected Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning. However, showers from 03:00 Wednesday morning and widespread rainfall Wednesday afternoon could cause flooding. From 22:00 16/11/2022, flooding could affect fields, rural roads, gardens, and approach properties near Dean's Water Mill at Lindfield Bridge on the B2028 near Lindfield. Flood water will also affect Sloop Lane, Fletching Mill Bridge, Sharpsbridge, the Anchor Inn and Barcombe Mills Road. Only small amounts of rain are forecast Thursday to Saturday, which should allow the River Ouse to return nearer to normal Thursday evening. If we receive the maximum amounts of rain predicted, river levels could peak similar to last week. Barcombe Mills Road may become impassable. Please plan to avoid driving through routes vulnerable to flooding. We are operating our structures at Pimms Lock and Barcombe to help keep the river flowing freely and reduce flood risk. We will update this message by 14:00 16/11/2022.

The Bull River in Hellingly is high and rising, but should begin to fall by 22:00 15/11/2022. However, showers from 03:00 early Wednesday morning, followed by widespread rainfall Wednesday afternoon, could cause flooding. From 20:00 16/11/2022, flooding could affect fields, rural roads, gardens and approach properties on Mill Lane, Hellingly, Grove Hill near Grovebridge Farm, and Hammer Lane near Cowbeech. From 22:00 16/11/2022, flood impacts could also affect properties on Station Road, Church Lane and Church Road, Hellingly. From 05:00 17/11/2022, flooding could also affect North Street, Litlington Road, Willows Car Park, River Lane, The Old Clergy House and Deans Place Hotel, Alfriston. Drier weather Thursday to Saturday should allow the rivers to return nearer to normal by the weekend. If we receive the maximum amounts of rain predicted, river levels could peak similar to last week. Please plan to avoid driving through routes susceptible to flooding in Hellingly and Alfriston. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 14:00 16/11/2022.

items.description: River Mole and its tributaries from Kinnersley Manor to South Hersham
items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
River levels have risen as a result of heavy rain. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible from approximately 7pm today, Tuesday 15 November 2022, between Kinnersley Manor and Sidlow, although there may be other areas of minor flooding.  Property flooding is not currently expected.
Further heavy rainfall is forecast over the next 2 days. We expect river levels to remain high. 
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are clearing trash screens and actively monitoring the situation and are prepared to respond if required.
This message will be updated by 8am on Wednesday 16 November 2022, or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message: River levels have risen as a result of heavy rainfall today. Flooding of roads and low lying land is expected from midnight tonight. We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads around Water Lane and Haxted Road. Flooding of properties is not forecast at this point. Further rainfall is forecast over the next two days. We expect river levels to remain high until Thursday, 17/11/2022. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are out on the ground checking and clearing any blockages and debris from rivers and actively monitoring the situation and are prepared to respond if required. Please stay aware in case further warnings are issued. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 16/11/2022, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Littlemead Brook, Cranleigh Waters, Hascombe Stream

items.message: Property flooding is not currently expected. River levels remain high but are beginning to fall on the Littlemead Brook following earlier heavy rainfall. Therefore, flooding of roads and low lying land is expected to continue this evening 15/11/22. Further rainfall is forecast over the next few days, therefore levels may rise again. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and refer to the 'River and Sea levels in England' webpage for current river levels. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 16/11/22, or as the situation changes.

The Western Rother is high and rising. Nearly half a month's rain (40mm) has been recorded at Liss on Tuesday. This is a lot in a short period. From 15:00 15/11/2022 flooding could affect fields, rural roads, gardens in Liss, Mill Lane and Old Mill Lane, Sheet. From 18:00 15/11/2022 minor flood impacts will affect gardens near Iping Mill and Stedham Mill. In Midhurst, water will be very high at The Wharf. From 21:00 15/11/2022 flood water will approach properties at Lodsbridge, near Selham and Fittleworth Mill, and nearby properties in Fittleworth. Further heavy showers are expected Tuesday night and early Wednesday morning. Another 20-30mm of rain is also predicted Wednesday evening. We expect river levels to rise again and possibly higher Wednesday evening. If we receive the maximum amounts of rain predicted, river levels could peak higher than last week. Early actions to reduce potential impacts at Lodsbridge and Fittleworth are encouraged. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 11:00 16/11/2022.

The River Lox is high and rising, following 30mm of heavy rainfall recorded at Chiddingfold on Tuesday. Further heavy showers are expected Tuesday night and early Wednesday morning, which could cause the river to rise again. If as much rain falls as predicted, minor flooding could affect fields, rural roads and gardens along the length of the river Lox. From Wednesday afternoon flood water could potentially approach properties near Brewhurst Mill on Brewhurst Lane and the Onslow Arms, Loxwood. Another 20-30mm of rain is expected Wednesday evening, which could cause river levels to rise again, before finally beginning to fall by 17:00 Thursday 17/11/2022. Please continue to operate private water control structures at Brewhurst to reduce the risk of flooding there. We continue to monitor the levels and forecast. We will update this message by 12:00 on 16/11/2022.

The Aldingbourne and Barnham Rifes are high and rising. Nearly double the monthly average rainfall (150mm) has already been recorded in November. From 20:00 on 15/11/2022, small amounts of flood water will affect fields near Shripney Lane and the A259. The river should initially begin to fall by 03:00 on 16/11/2022. However, further heavy showers are expected Tuesday night and early Wednesday morning. Another 20-30mm of rain is also expected Wednesday evening. If we receive the maximum amounts of rain predicted, river levels could peak higher than last week. From Wednesday afternoon, flood impacts could affect parts of the Tesco car park on Shripney Road and land around caravans at Riverside Caravan Centre and Rowan Park Caravan Park. Only minimal or minor flood impacts are currently expected in Barnham. Some roads may become impassable. Please plan to avoid driving through routes vulnerable to flooding. Our pumps at Felpham are running to reduce flood risk. We will update this message by 12:00 on 16/11/2022.

items.description: Rivers Clyst and Culm and their tributaries
items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message:
Flooding is possible on the afternoon of Tuesday 15th November.
Over the last 24 hours we have seen heavy rainfall in the River Clyst and Culm area. This has caused the levels in the Rivers Clyst and Culm to rise. Further heavy showers are forecast this evening which will cause river levels to remain high.
The main areas of concern are low lying land and roads close to the river.
Flood warnings are not expected to be issued and no flooding to properties is currently forecast.
Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. 
We are closely monitoring river levels. This message will be updated on Wednesday afternoon (16/11/22) or earlier if the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly
items.message: The risk of flooding has now reduced, and rivers have fallen below levels of concern, but will remain sensitive to further rainfall. The heavy rainfall experienced overnight Monday 14th November has cleared the area but further heavy rain showers are expected this afternoon and this evening. We will continue to closely monitor the situation and issue any further updates as necessary.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Coly, River Yarty, Umborne Brook

items.message:
Flooding is possible on the afternoon of Tuesday 15th November.
Over the last 24 hours we have seen heavy rainfall in the East Devon area which has caused water levels to rise. Further heavy showers are forecast this evening which will cause river levels to remain high and we may issue Flood Warnings as necessary.
The main areas of concern are low lying land and roads close to the river.
Take care near the areas of concern and monitor your local weather conditions. 
We are closely monitoring river levels. This message will be updated on Wednesday afternoon (16/11/22) or earlier if the situation changes.

River levels are rising at the Chiselborough river gauge due to heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today, 15/11/22.  Areas most at risk are roads at Ashford Mill, Isle Brewers, Fivehead, the Norton sub Hambdon to Stratton road, the A356 and the B3165 at Chiselborough and the B3168 at Ilford Bridges. The lower River Parrett is forecast to be bankfull and overtopping could occur. Further heavy showers are expected over the next 24 hours. We are closely monitoring the situation and our incident response staff are clearing weed screens. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures. This message will be updated by 12:00 on Wednesday, 16/11/22, or as the situation changes.

items.message: The risk of flooding from the River Plym has now reduced, and river levels are falling below levels of concern. No further flooding is expected on Tuesday, however rainfall is forecast on Wednesday 16th November which may result in further Flood Alerts being issued.

The Flood Alert has now been removed as river levels on the Upper Dorset Frome and River Hooke are slowly dropping. Be aware that standing water and debris may still remain. There are showers forecast for this evening (15/11/22) and tomorrow morning (16/11/22) but these are not expected to increase river levels We will continue to monitor the forecast and issue an alert if necessary.

The Flood Warning has now been removed as river levels on the Upper Dorset Frome are slowly dropping. Be aware that standing water and debris may still remain. There are showers forecast for this evening (15/11/22) and tomorrow morning (16/11/22) but these are not expected to increase river levels We will continue to monitor the forecast and issue an alert if necessary.

items.description: River Parrett (upper) from South Perrott to Thorney
items.message: River levels are rising at the Chiselborough river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads, farmland and property is possible today, 15/11/22.  Areas most at risk are the River Parrett downstream of Gawbridge, the A356 at Chiselborough, the Norton Sub Hamdon to Stratton road and Parrett Works near Martock. Further showery rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are clearing weed screens. Please refer to local authority website for local road closures and can owners with property flood resilience equipment install it now. This message will be updated by 12:00 on Wednesday, 16/11/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers in the Forest of Dean
items.message:
River levels are forecast to rise at the Parkend river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible between this evening 15/11/22 and tomorrow afternoon, 16/11/22.  We expect flooding to affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Gloucester to Chepstow. Other locations that may be affected include Westbury and Lydney.   
River levels may remain elevated over the next two days, as further showers are expected. 
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Please call 999 if in immediate danger.  
This message will be updated by 09:00 on 16/11/22, or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Stour, River Lodden, River Shreen

items.message:
River levels are rising steadily on the Upper Dorset Stour, Shreen Water.
Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Upper Dorset Stour, Shreen Water, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Gillingham and Sturminster Newton.
Flooding is possible at tributaries between Gillingham and Sturminster Newton from 06:00 PM on 15/11/2022.
Further rainfall is forecast overnight.
River levels are rising at the Colesbrook, Gillingham Le Neubourg Way, Hammoon, Lodden Bridge, Milton on Stour  gauge.
We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 16/11/2022, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Brokenborough river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall throughout Tuesday morning. Consequently, the risk of flooding remains. We expect flooding to affect the road at Reybridge.   
Further showery rainfall is forecast throughout Tuesday evening and into Wednesday. We expect river levels to fall overnight on Tuesday 15/11/22, but they are forecast to rise again during Wednesday evening in response to another band of rainfall moving over the area.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff have been clearing weed screens.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  
This message will be updated on Wednesday morning,16/11/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Middle Stour from Hammoon to Sturminster Marshall
items.message: River levels continue to rise on the Middle Dorset Stour due to the rainfall in the last 36hours. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the Middle Dorset Stour, with low lying land expected to be most affected, particularly around Hammoon, Bere Marsh, Stourpaine, Durweston and Lower Blandford St Mary. Further rainfall is forecast however this afternoon which may lead to further river rises although the impact of this will be clearer later today and will be covered in an update to this flood warning. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and are checking rivers for blockages in the area. Consider activating any property flood protection products. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. Plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. Plan driving routes to avoid the Hammoon road as the gates are locked closed as the road has been affected by flooding. This message will be updated 17:00 on the 16/11/22, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Stour and Iwerne at Stourpaine
items.message: River levels continue to rise on the Middle Dorset Stour due to the rainfall in the last 36hours. Areas most at risk include Havelins and the SPFA sports pavilion areas in Stourpaine. Further rainfall is forecast this afternoon which may lead to further river rises although the forecast of the impact of this will be clearer later today and will be covered in an update to this flood warning. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Consider activating any property flood protection products. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. Consider putting your flood plan into action. This message will be updated by 17:00 on 16/11/22, or as the situation changes.
